intro: Acioa dewevrei var. seretii, commonly known as the Seretii acioa, is a rare and delicate plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants known for their ornamental value. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and prominent stamens. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
